experiment.basic module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
Note:A simple example of an experiment class with all the necessary components
class experiment.basic.Basic(trials=100, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: experiment.experimentTemplate.Experiment

An example of an experiment with all the necessary components, but nothing changing

Parameters:trials (int) – The number of trials in the experiment
Name¶

The name of the class used when recording what has been used.

Type:string
feedback()[source]¶

Responds to the action from the participant

next()[source]¶

Produces the next stimulus for the iterator

Returns:
  • stimulus (None)
  • nextValidActions (Tuple of ints or None) – The list of valid actions that the model can respond with. Set to (0,1), as they never vary.
Raises:StopIteration
proceed()[source]¶

Updates the experiment after feedback

receiveAction(action)[source]¶

Receives the next action from the participant

Parameters:action (int or string) – The action taken by the model
returnTaskState()[source]¶

Returns all the relevant data for this experiment run

Returns:results – A dictionary containing the class parameters as well as the other useful data
Return type:dictionary
storeState()[source]¶

Stores the state of all the important variables so that they can be output later

experiment.basic.basicRewardDirect()[source]¶

Processes the reward for models expecting just the reward

Returns:basicReward – The function expects to be passed a tuple containing the reward and the last action. The function returns the reward.
Return type:function
experiment.basic.Name¶

The identifier of the function

Type:string

See also

model.QLearn(), model.QLearn2()

experiment.basic.basicStimulusDirect()[source]¶

Processes the stimulus cues for models expecting just the event

Returns:basicStimulus – The function returns a tuple of 1 and the observation.
Return type:function
experiment.basic.Name

The identifier of the function

Type:string

model.QLearn(), model.QLearn2()
